Common karwinskii mezcal; herbal and green profile

Huge traditional mezcal agave; big layered spirits

Hybrid or americana like mezcal agave; rich herbaceous spirits

Important regional mezcal species; also domestication ancestor for A. hookeri

Key species for raicilla and some mezcal style spirits

Valued for high-yield organoleptic-quality mezcal in Guerrero; emerging commercial potential amid limited cultivation

Wild form of angustifolia used for rustic mezcals
Ornamental with potential beverage use; wild-harvested sparingly due to remote habitats valued for striking fibrous leaves

Traditional regional mezcal and agave spirit; more often known for fibre but used locally for rustic mezcals

Used specifically for small-batch wild or semi-wild mezcals labeled "Chuparrosa" with producers describing distinctive floral spicy and subtly sweet profiles
